meanings.definition: The act of making something more potent or powerful.
meanings.sent1: The potentiation of the medicine increased its strength.
meanings.sent2: The potentiation of the potion made it more effective.
meanings.sent3: The magician's potentiation of the spell made it unstoppable.
meanings.sent4: The potentiation of the team's efforts led to a remarkable victory.
meanings.sent5: The potentiation of the plant's growth was remarkable to witness.

meanings.definition: The process of increasing the effectiveness of a drug or substance.
meanings.sent1: The potentiation of the medication improved its impact.
meanings.sent2: The potentiation of the remedy boosted its efficacy.
meanings.sent3: The chef's potentiation of the recipe made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The potentiation of the fertilizer made the plants thrive.
meanings.sent5: The potentiation of the treatment accelerated the healing process.

meanings.definition: The enhancement of a biological or chemical response.
meanings.sent1: The potentiation of the enzyme increased its activity.
meanings.sent2: The potentiation of the reaction amplified its effects.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's potentiation of the experiment yielded surprising results.
meanings.sent4: The potentiation of the immune system helped fight off the infection.
meanings.sent5: The potentiation of the scent attracted more pollinators to the flower.
